Folder.Name: BLM Relative Rocks v1.2 (README inside, turn this folder on to use)

Trigger.Name: Find BLM color + set 2 blue players
!README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
This trigger alls out your cardinal/intercardinal position as seen in https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/786557239292985364/798996683685232640/blm_uptime.png
The folder that does all the stuff automatically turns on for a minute when the boss uses Earthen Fury, it turns itself off to save resources.
The "Priority" trigger dictates who gets priority on the northeast blue spot in set 2 when BLM has orange, it's easy to modify and the order the jobs are added to the list there is the priority and you can move jobs up or down to modify it to your liking. Make sure your entire group has the same priority set there or people can get the same blue spot called. Higher up in the trigger = higher priority to be picked for northeast.
If you're the BLM don't use this, you're afk northwest anyway and all the DPS TTS assumes that it's from the non-BLM pov. Your job is to convince your entire party to use this.
Version history: v1.1: Added TTS for set 3 v1.2: Folder now won't activate if there is no BLM in the party (since you're probably not doing this strat then)

Action.UseTTSTextExpression: Bait at blue, move to orange
Bait at orange, move to blue

Trigger.Name: Prismatic Solver
Trigger.Description:
This trigger calls out Prismatic Deception safe spots when the casts of Blasting Zone start on the enemy list. The calls by default are North, Northeast, East, Southeast, obviously the cardinal/intercardinal direction opposite of what the trigger calls will be safe too. If you prefer, you can change the things the TTS actions call in the Trigger Actions tab of the this trigger.
Version History: v1.4: Public Release v1.5: Rewrote part of this trigger to have fewer moving parts since it wasn't executing consistently v1.6: I swear to god this thing works now

Folder.Name: Combat (READMEs inside folders, enable whatever you want)

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
!! In order for this trigger to work, a HoT tick must have occured on your character since you last changed zones. !!
Ingame commands: /echo !tickshow /echo !tickhide
In order to change the location of the progress bar, first copy this entire folder to local triggers or you can't edit anything. Don't have it enabled as a local and remote trigger at the same time!
To move the progress bar to a different location, open the "Move me!" action in the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, click "Use visual guide for placement", move it to where you want and right click to save the location.

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger (AA Timer)
Trigger.Description:
Ingame commands: /echo !aashow /echo !aahide
If you're reading this from within my remote repository, copy paste this folder into your local triggers first and enable it there. To move the progress bar, switch to the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, double click the first action named "Move me!" and click the button saying "Use visual guide for placement". You can then drag it to whereever you want, save your selection with right click -> save and everything will automatically adjust to where you put it. If you move it while already enabled, you will need to use the /echo !aashow command again for it to update.
The trigger will show a progress bar displaying the time until your next auto attack is ready. Works exclusively for combat jobs and is intended for play at level 80+ since low level weapons don't always have the same delay as level 80 weapons, I can't actually tell what your weapon delay is and just assume it's at the value that's standard for your job for current max level weapons. It may still work correctly for lower levels given you have a weapon with the same delay as your job's max level weapons equipped.
The only auto attack speed effects the trigger will take into account are SAM/BLM/WHM/NIN/MNK/BRD haste effects so you will not see anything else considered since those are typically all that occur in a raid environment.
If you break something tell me on discord, Aya#0847 --------------- Documentation on how auto attack edge cases work:
Haste effects being gained/lost between autos: Your next auto will happen based on the current haste effects - if you lose greased lightning 0.1s before an auto attack, that entire auto attack will be moved back as if you never had greased lightning. Conversely, gaining a haste effect does the opposite thing and moves the next auto forward in accordance with how potent that haste effect is - gaining a haste effect just before an auto that would have happened anyway soon will result in it happening instantly as you gain the effect. All this is reflected correctly in the trigger.
Casts: Using anything with a cast bar pauses your auto attack timer until you make it to the slidecast window and this behavior should work properly in the trigger.
Channels: Channeling something like improvisation on dancer simply disables your ability to auto attack but the timer will still progress as normal.
TCJ: Tracking the time until first auto after TCJ is not supported due to TCJ being extremely weird. The first auto attack after it will happen at the first possible time that is your auto delay + some whole number. For example, without huton your auto delay is 2.56 and your next auto after TCJ can only occur after 3.56s, 4.56s, 5.56s, 6.56s... etc. relative to the last auto before TCJ. As such, I simply don't know when your next auto will be until TCJ ends, at which point it will never take more than a full second for another auto attack to occur, implementing support for that is more effort than it's worth.
Today I learned this line type is bugged in triggernometry for network logs so I can't use that

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
Ingame commands: /echo !gbon /echo !gboff
This trigger calls out ghosted attacks (i.e. damage actions you casted but that didn't connect due to the target becoming invulnerable or the damage being 100% overkill due to the enemy dying or being stuck at 1 HP due to mechanics).
It won't activate in AOE situations (using AOE skills on a single target still works) since in logs it looks like something ghosts as long as it ghosted on what the game considers to be the primary target of the AOE, even if it did damage elsewhere.
Note that if you're trying this on a dummy, you may be overkilling it pretty frequently resulting in the trigger complaining.
